tit.j: 三日平氏の乱 (鎌倉時代)
tit.e: Mikka Heishi no ran (Three days rebellion of the Taira clan in the Kamakura Period)
Mikka Heishi War (Three days rebellion of the Taira clan in the Kamakura Period)
tit.cmt: 翻訳仕様指示書に従って、「乱」は"War"に統一しました。
tit.e: Mikka Heishi War (Three days rebellion of the Taira clan in the Kamakura Period)

sen.j: 三日平氏の乱（みっかへいしのらん）は、鎌倉時代初期、伊勢国と伊賀国で平家の残党が蜂起した事件。
sen.e: Mikka Heishi no ran (Three-days rebellion of the Taira clan) is a rebellion caused by the remnants of the Taira clan in Ise and Iga Provinces at the beginning of the Kamakura period.
Mikka Heishi War (Three-days rebellion of the Taira clan) is a rebellion caused by the remnants of the Taira clan in Ise and Iga Provinces at the beginning of the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 翻訳仕様指示書に従って、「乱」は"War"に統一しました。
sen.e: Mikka Heishi War (Three-days rebellion of the Taira clan) is a rebellion caused by the remnants of the Taira clan in Ise and Iga Provinces at the beginning of the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 建仁3年（1203年）12月に伊勢平氏の若菜五郎が蜂起し、討伐に向かった鎌倉幕府軍の平賀朝雅が、元久元年（1204年）4月10日から12日の間に反乱軍を鎮圧した事から「三日平氏の乱」と称された。
sen.e: In December 1203, Goro WAKANA of Ise-Heishi (Taira clan) raised a rebellion, which was referred to as Mikka Heishi no ran (Three-days rebellion of the Taira clan) due to the historical fact that Tomomasa HIRAGA of the Kamakura bakufu army was sent to the area and quelled the rebellion in a three day period, April 10 to 12 in 1204.

In January 1204, Goro WAKANA of Ise-Heishi (Taira clan) raised a rebellion, which was referred to as Mikka Heishi War (Three-days rebellion of the Taira clan) due to the historical fact that Tomomasa HIRAGA of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) army was sent to the area and quelled the rebellion in a three day period, from May 18 to 20 in 1204.
sen.cmt: 建仁3年（1203年）12月→新暦では西暦1204年1月。翻訳仕様指示書に従って、「乱」は"War"に統一しました。「幕府」の説明を用語統一リストに従って追記。元久元年（1204年）4月10日から12日→新暦では5月18日から20日。
sen.e: In January 1204, Goro WAKANA of Ise-Heishi (Taira clan) raised a rebellion, which was referred to as Mikka Heishi War (Three-days rebellion of the Taira clan) due to the historical fact that Tomomasa HIRAGA of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) army was sent to the area and quelled the rebellion in a three day period, from May 18 to 20 in 1204.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: After the death of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, the first shogun of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), internal conflicts frequently occurred in the bakufu.

sen.j: 正治2年（1200年）正月に梶原景時の変を受けて平安京において城長茂の反乱が起こるなど、その影響は都にも及んだ。
sen.e: As Nagamochi JO raised a rebellion in Heiankyo on New Year's Day of 1200 after the Kagetoki KAJIWARA Incident, the internal conflicts disturbed the peace of the capital.

sen.j: 建仁3年（1203年）9月の比企能員の変・2代将軍源頼家の追放によって12歳の3代将軍源実朝が擁立され、北条時政が実権を握った。
sen.e: After the second shogun, MINAMOTO no Yoriie, was expelled from the bakufu following the Conspiracy of Yoshikazu HIKI in September 1203, MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, who was 12 years old then, was backed up to become the third shogun and Tokimasa HOJO took the helm of the bakufu.

sen.j: 一方、伊勢国・伊賀国地域は治承・寿永の乱で滅亡した伊勢平氏の本拠地であり、元暦元年（1184年）の三日平氏の乱 (平安時代)で平家残党の蜂起が鎮圧された後も根絶された訳ではなく、隠然たる勢力があった。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Ise and Iga Provinces were the base of Ise Heishi (Taira clan) destroyed in the Jisho-Juei War and the remnants survived to maintain latent powers even after Mikka Heishi no ran (Heian period), raised by the remnants in 1184, was quelled.

tit.cmt: 乱の過程を説明しているので、見出しとしては"History"の方が良いと思います。

sen.j: 平家残党は20年の雌伏を経て、将軍後継問題で揺れる幕府の動揺に乗じて建仁3年（1203年）12月、伊勢平氏若菜五郎が軍勢を率いて伊勢国の守護である山内首藤経俊の舘を襲撃し、再び反乱の兵を挙げた。
sen.e: After biding their time for 20 years, the remnants of the Taira clan lead by Goro WAKANA of Ise Heishi took advantage of the turmoil in the government, which was caused by the shogun's successor issue, and attacked the house of Tsuneyoshi YAMAUCHI SUDO serving as the shugo of Ise Province to raise a rebellion again in December 1203.

After biding their time for 20 years, the remnants of the Taira clan led by Goro WAKANA of Ise Heishi took advantage of the turmoil in the government, which was caused by the shogun's successor issue, and attacked the house of Tsunetoshi YAMANOUCHI SUDO serving as the shugo of Ise Province to raise a rebellion again in January 1204.
sen.cmt: "lead"→"led"に修正。「山内首藤経俊」→経俊は「つねとし」です。また「山内」はweb上のwikipediaでは「やまうち」ですが、辞書では「やまのうち」で、こちらの表記が多いことから、「やまのうち」に修正しました。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%B1%B1%E5%86%85%E9%A6%96%E8%97%A4%E7%B5%8C%E4%BF%8A）建仁3年（1203年）12月→新暦では1204年1月。
sen.e: After biding their time for 20 years, the remnants of the Taira clan led by Goro WAKANA of Ise Heishi took advantage of the turmoil in the government, which was caused by the shogun's successor issue, and attacked the house of Tsunetoshi YAMANOUCHI SUDO serving as the shugo of Ise Province to raise a rebellion again in January 1204.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 山内首藤経俊はこの襲撃事件を平氏反乱の兆しとは気づかず、12月25日に侍所別当和田義盛が幕府に事件の張本を伊勢国員弁郡の郡司進士行綱と報告し、翌元久元年（1204年）2月、行綱は召し捕られ囚人とされた。
sen.e: Tsuneyoshi YAMAUCHI SUDO did not recognize this attack as a rebellion of the Taira clan and Samurai-dokoro betto (the superior of the board of retainers), Yoshimori WADA, reported to the bakufu that the incident was caused by Yukitsuna Gunji Shinshi of Inabe County, Ise Province, who was captured and sent to prison in February 1204.

Tsunetoshi YAMANOUCHI SUDO did not recognize this attack as a rebellion of the Taira clan and Samurai-dokoro betto (the superior of the board of retainers), Yoshimori WADA, reported to the bakufu that the incident was caused by Yukitsuna SHINSHI, gunji (official of a county) of Inabe County, Ise Province, who was captured and sent to prison in March 1204.
sen.cmt: 「山内首藤経俊」→経俊は「つねとし」です。また「山内」はweb上のwikipediaでは「やまうち」ですが、辞書では「やまのうち」で、こちらの表記が多いことから、「やまのうち」に修正しました。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%B1%B1%E5%86%85%E9%A6%96%E8%97%A4%E7%B5%8C%E4%BF%8A）「郡司進士行綱」→郡司（役職）の進士行綱という人物のこと。元久元年（1204年）2月→新暦では3月。
sen.e: Tsunetoshi YAMANOUCHI SUDO did not recognize this attack as a rebellion of the Taira clan and Samurai-dokoro betto (the superior of the board of retainers), Yoshimori WADA, reported to the bakufu that the incident was caused by Yukitsuna SHINSHI, gunji (official of a county) of Inabe County, Ise Province, who was captured and sent to prison in March 1204.

sen.j: しかし同2月、伊賀で平維基の子孫らが、伊勢で平度光の子息らが蜂起し、両国の守護の経俊が赴いたが問答無用で襲撃され、無勢の経俊は逃亡した。
sen.e: However, in February of that year, descendants of TAIRA no Koremoto and a group including sons of TAIRA no Norimitsu respectively raised a rebellion in Iga and Ise and Tsuneyoshi, serving as the shugo in both the provinces, traveled to quell the rebellions, but he was attacked without having any talks and run away lamely.

However, in the same month, March, descendants of TAIRA no Koremoto and a group including sons of TAIRA no Koremitsu respectively raised a rebellion in Iga and Ise and Tsunetoshi, serving as the shugo in both the provinces, traveled to quell the rebellions, but he was attacked without having any talks and ran away lamely.

sen.j: この報告を受けた幕府は元久元年（1204年）3月10日、ついで3月29日に京都守護の平賀朝雅に京畿の御家人達を率いて伊勢・伊賀両国へ出陣することを命じた。
sen.e: After receiving reports of these rebellions, the bakufu ordered Tomomasa HIRAGA serving as the Kyoto shugo to lead Gokenins of Keiki (area around Kyoto) and go off to Ise and Iga Provinces on March 10 and 29, 1204.

After receiving reports of these rebellions, on April 18 and May 7, 1204, the bakufu ordered Tomomasa HIRAGA serving as the Kyoto shugo to lead Gokenin of Keiki (area around Kyoto) and go off to Ise and Iga Provinces.
sen.cmt: 元久元年（1204年）3月10日→新暦では4月18日。3月29日→新暦では5月7日。日付を文の最後に置くと、「その日に出陣すること」を命じた、とも取れるので修正しました。"Gokenin"はローマ字表記の単語なので、複数形のsは付けない方が良いと思います。

sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 京都では反乱軍の勢力は千余人に及ぶとの風聞があり、3月21日、後鳥羽天皇の御所で議定があり、伊賀国を朝雅の知行国と定め、追討の便宜を図った。
sen.e: There was a rumor that more than 1000 warriors joined in the force of the rebels, and a gijo (official meeting) was held in Gosho (Imperial Palace) of the Emperor Gotoba to designate Iga Province as Tomomasa's chigyo koku (provincial fiefdom) for justifying his punitive expedition.

sen.j: 幕府では5月10日に論功行賞が行われ、山内首藤経俊は伊賀・伊勢の守護を剥奪された。
sen.e: The bakufu examined achievement of each person and granted the rewards according to the achievement on May 10, and Tsuneyoshi YAMAUCHI SUDO was disqualified as the shugo of Iga and Ise.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳分の例外対処
sen.e: The bakufu examined achievement of each person and granted the rewards according to the achievement on June 16, and Tsunetoshi YAMANOUCHI SUDO was disqualified as the shugo of Iga and Ise.
sen.cmt: 「山内首藤経俊」→経俊は「つねとし」です。また「山内」はweb上のwikipediaでは「やまうち」ですが、辞書では「やまのうち」で、こちらの表記が多いことから、「やまのうち」に修正しました。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%B1%B1%E5%86%85%E9%A6%96%E8%97%A4%E7%B5%8C%E4%BF%8A）5月10日→新暦では6月16日。
sen.e: The bakufu examined achievement of each person and granted the rewards according to the achievement on June 16, and Tsunetoshi YAMANOUCHI SUDO was disqualified as the shugo of Iga and Ise.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 朝雅が兼務することとなり、謀反人の所領は朝雅に与えられた。
sen.e: Tomomasa took over the position while maintaining his previous positions and the territories of the rebels were granted to him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳分の例外対処
sen.e: Tomomasa took over the position while maintaining his previous positions and the territories of the rebels were granted to him.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 加藤光員も恩賞を受けた。
sen.e: Mitsukazu KATO also received Onsho (reward grants).
Mitsukazu KATO also received reward grants.
sen.cmt: 前列で"rewards"という単語を使っているので、ここで「恩賞」をローマ字表記する必要はないと思います。
sen.e: Mitsukazu KATO also received reward grants.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

tit.cmt: 前列に入力されていました。

sen.j: 平賀朝雅は上北面武士として後鳥羽院の殿上人に加えられ、京都守護、伊勢守護、伊賀知行国主となって御家人としては異例の権勢を強めた。
sen.e: Tomomasa HIRAGA was added to Tenjyobito (Senior officer serving the Emperor) of Gotoba-in (the retired Emperor Gotoba) and served as the shugo of Kyoto and Ise and chigyo-kokushu of Iga (the lord of Iga) to strengthen his unusually strong power as Gokenin.

Tomomasa HIRAGA was added to Tenjobito (senior officer serving the Emperor) for the Retired Emperor Gotoba as a senior guard of his palace and served as the shugo of Kyoto and Ise as well as chigyo-kokushu of Iga (the lord of Iga) and enjoyed his unusually strong power for Gokenin.
sen.cmt: 「上北面武士として」→訳抜けです。院の御所を警護する武士のうち、位の高い方。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E4%B8%8A%E5%8C%97%E9%9D%A2）「殿上人」のスペルを修正。「後鳥羽院」はローマ字表記せず、"the Retired Emperor Gotoba"で良いと思います。"to strengthen his unusually strong power as Gokenin"→strengthenとstrongが重複しているので、修正しました。
sen.e: Tomomasa HIRAGA was added to Tenjobito (senior officer serving the Emperor) for the Retired Emperor Gotoba as a senior guard of his palace and served as the shugo of Kyoto and Ise as well as chigyo-kokushu of Iga (the lord of Iga) and enjoyed his unusually strong power for Gokenin.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 翌年の元久2年（1205年）閏7月、朝雅と畠山重保との口論に端を発した牧氏事件が起こり、舅の北条時政が幕府を追放された。
sen.e: July in Next year, 1205, Makishi Incident, which started from the quarrel between Tomomasa and Shigeyasu HATAKEYAMA, was caused and Tokimasa HOJO, father in law, was expelled from the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳分の例外対処
sen.e: In August of the next year, 1205, Makishi Incident occurred from the quarrel between Tomomasa and Shigeyasu HATAKEYAMA, and Tokimasa HOJO, Tomomasa's father-in-law, was expelled from the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 元久2年（1205年）閏7月→新暦では1205年8月「舅」→朝雅の舅、と補足しました。他、文法上の修正をしました。
sen.e: In August of the next year, 1205, Makishi Incident occurred from the quarrel between Tomomasa and Shigeyasu HATAKEYAMA, and Tokimasa HOJO, Tomomasa's father-in-law, was expelled from the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 朝雅は実権を握った時政の子北条義時の命で派遣された山内首藤通基（経俊の子）に殺害された。
sen.e: Tomomasa was killed by Michimoto YAMAUCHI SUDO (son of Tsuneyoshi YAMAUCHI SUDO) who was sent by Yoshitoki HOJO (son of Tokimasa HOJO) taking the helm of the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳分の例外対処
sen.e: Tomomasa was killed by Michimoto YAMANOUCHI SUDO (son of Tsunetoshi YAMANOUCHI SUDO) who was sent by Yoshitoki HOJO (son of Tokimasa HOJO) taking the helm of the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 「山内首藤経俊」→経俊は「つねとし」です。また「山内」はweb上のwikipediaでは「やまうち」ですが、辞書では「やまのうち」で、こちらの表記が多いことから、「やまのうち」に修正しました。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%B1%B1%E5%86%85%E9%A6%96%E8%97%A4%E7%B5%8C%E4%BF%8A）
sen.e: Tomomasa was killed by Michimoto YAMANOUCHI SUDO (son of Tsunetoshi YAMANOUCHI SUDO) who was sent by Yoshitoki HOJO (son of Tokimasa HOJO) taking the helm of the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 朝雅の死を受けて経俊は職の回復を幕府に願ったが、許されなかった。
sen.e: After Tomomasa died, Tsuneyoshi requested the bakufu to allow him to come back to the previous positions, but his request was not accepted.
After Tomomasa died, Tsunetoshi requested the bakufu to allow him to come back to the previous positions, but his request was not accepted.
sen.cmt: 「経俊」→「つねとし」です。
sen.e: After Tomomasa died, Tsunetoshi requested the bakufu to allow him to come back to the previous positions, but his request was not accepted.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 岡野友彦は平氏側の拠点となった伊賀国六箇山の領家が平光盛（平頼盛の子）であった事実と杉橋隆夫が唱えた牧宗親・池禅尼兄弟説（すなわち平賀朝雅の義母牧の方と平頼盛を従兄弟とする）を採用している。
sen.e: Tomohiko OKANO adopted the fact that the ryoke (virtual proprietor of manor) of Mt.Rokka in Iga Province, where the base of the Taira clan lay in, was TAIRA no Mitsumori (son of TAIRA no Yorimori) and Takao SUGIBASHI's theory that Munechika MAKI was Ike no zenni's brother, that is, Maki no Kata, who was Tomomasa's mother, in law was TAIRA no Yorimori's cousin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳分の例外対処

sen.j: これらの情報から、岡野はこの事件を平賀朝雅と平光盛ら池家一族が自己の勢力拡大のために平氏残党を唆して仕組んだ「自作自演」の可能性を指摘している。
sen.e: Based on these information, OKANO pointed out that the possibility that Tomomasa HIRAGA and IKE family including TAIRA no Mitsumori attempted to get the remnants of the Taira clan to cause the rebellion for expanding their powers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳分の例外対処
sen.e: Based on these information, Okano points out the possibility that Tomomasa HIRAGA and the Ike family including TAIRA no Mitsumori attempted to get the remnants of the Taira clan to raise the rebellion for expanding their powers.
sen.cmt: 文法上の修正、用語統一リストに沿った修正をしました。
